Alice Leader is a former teacher who loves teaching children. She took a group of 12- and 13-year-olds to visit Hadrian's Wall in Britain. The wall is an old Roman wall that is 120 km long and 5 meters high. The students were very interested in the wall, but they wanted to know why it was built. Alice couldn't find a good book to explain it, so she decided to write one herself.
After teaching for 31 years, Alice retired and started writing books for children. She wanted to write stories that are not too dark or too fantastical. She believes that children's books often focus too much on negative experiences or magic. Alice's books are different because they are based on real events and people.
Alice used to teach English and History together. She loved seeing children go from being bored to being interested in a subject. She loves making learning fun. Writing books is similar to teaching, but it's less tiring. Alice's husband, Zachary Leader, is a writer and editor who helps her with her books. He gives her good advice on how to make her writing better.
Alice wrote her first book after taking a creative writing course. The course was a big help, and her teacher suggested she publish her work. Alice's husband was very helpful in editing her book. She thinks that they make a good team because they have different writing styles.

Jonny and Alistair Brownlee, two famous triathletes, took part in a special race to raise money for charity. They were racing against each other and against a car. Jonny drove the car on the roads, while Alistair rode a mountain bike across the countryside.
"I'm excited," said Jonny. "I've never done anything like this before. The roads are beautiful, but it's cold today, so I'll stay warm in the car."
Alistair was also excited. "I've seen Jonny drive before, so I'm not sure he'll make it," he said. "I might stop for a cup of tea halfway."
The race started at a lake in the Yorkshire Dales and finished at a high road. The car had an easy time, but Alistair had a tough start with a big hill. He had to carry his bike up the hill and over fences.
Jonny had a problem too. A tractor blocked the road, and he had to wait. "Welcome to Yorkshire!" he joked.
Alistair was struggling with the hill, but he didn't give up. He finally reached the top and started to ride fast. Jonny was still driving, but he had to slow down because of the narrow roads.
Neither brother knew how close the other was. Jonny sped to the finish line, but Alistair was close behind. He stopped his bike and looked around, then raised his arms in victory.
"I did it!" he shouted. Jonny arrived a little later and said, "Well done, Alistair. I'm disappointed I didn't win."

When I play on Centre Court at Wimbledon, I notice the silence. I bounce the ball on the soft grass, and it makes no sound. I serve, hit the ball, and hear only my own shot. The quiet atmosphere helps me focus. I want to shut out everything except the game and the point I'm playing.
The silence is broken only by the applause and cheers when a point is over. I hear them, but it's like they're coming from far away. I don't think about the 15,000 people watching or the millions watching around the world. I'm too focused.
I've always dreamed of playing at Wimbledon. My coach, my uncle Toni, told me it was the biggest tournament. When I was 14, I thought about playing here and winning. Before 2008, I had played and lost to Roger Federer twice. The first time, I was happy to have made it so far. The second time, I was devastated. I knew I could have done better. I was so upset that I cried for half an hour in the dressing room.
My coach, Toni, is usually hard on me. He told me not to cry and that there would be more chances. I was worried that this might be my last chance to win Wimbledon. I know that professional athletes don't have a long time to play, and I want to make the most of it. Some moments are more important than others, and I had let a big one slip away.
But Toni was right. I got another chance in 2008. I was more confident that I had learned from my mistakes and would not let my head get in the way. I knew I would win. The night before the final, we didn't talk about the match at dinner. I was already thinking about it in my head, and I wanted to keep that to myself until the game started.

Jane Goodall is a famous English woman who spent most of her life in Africa. She was very passionate about animals and the environment. In 1957, she wrote to her family that she had finally found the Africa she had always dreamed of. She became a scientist, journalist, and activist, and is now considered one of the most important scientists of the 20th century.
Jane Goodall is known for her research on chimpanzees. She spent 40 years studying them in the wild and discovered many new things about them. Before her research, people didn't know that chimpanzees ate meat, used tools, or had emotions like humans do. Her work showed that chimpanzees are intelligent and social animals, just like humans.
Jane Goodall's book about her research, "The Chimpanzees of Gombe", is considered the most important book on the subject. Her work has changed the way scientists study animals and how people think about themselves. Even as a child, Jane was curious and liked to learn. When she was five years old, she went into a henhouse to find out how hens lay eggs. This might have been the start of her interest in biology.

Shirley Ford is a voiceover artist who can do many different voices. She talks to me like a cheeky 8-year-old boy, a tired mother, an old Scottish woman, and even a fast-talking alien! She has done voiceovers for many things, including cartoons, educational videos, and even vacuum cleaner adverts. She says it's not just about doing funny voices, but also about bringing the script to life for the audience.
Shirley started her career by taking a drama course and singing jingles for TV adverts. She then got a chance to do a voiceover for a cartoon and realized she was good at it. She has been doing voiceovers for many years and has worked with many big companies.
Shirley has to be very good at creating different voices and sounds. She even collects new voices by watching children's TV. She says that the key to doing a good job is to smile while you're talking, which makes your voice sound happy and cheerful.
It's very competitive to get work as a voiceover artist, so Shirley thinks it's important to have a good showreel, which is a recording that shows what you can do. She also recommends attending special workshops to learn more about voiceovers and to practice your skills. Shirley loves her job and is very passionate about voices. She says that sometimes she even talks like the characters she's doing voiceovers for, even when she's not in the studio!

Many people ask me how I became a cartoonist. It's a dream job that not many people achieve. Most people grow up and choose more realistic careers, like being a lawyer or engineer. But some people do become cartoonists. I studied graphic design in college and then started drawing cartoons for a newspaper. It was a lucky break, but you don't need a university degree or a lot of money to become a cartoonist. You just need to be creative and have a passion for drawing.
To be a successful cartoonist, you need to be good at many things. You need to be able to draw, but you also need to be able to write and think creatively. You need to be curious and interested in the world around you. And you need to be good at business and marketing. In the past, many cartoonists had regular jobs drawing cartoons for newspapers and magazines. But now, most cartoonists have to work for themselves and sell their own work.
Some people are worried about someone stealing their ideas, but it's not a big problem. You can protect your work by putting a copyright symbol on it. And even if someone does steal your work, it's not the end of the world. It could even be a lucky break!

Twenty years ago, I was moving house and getting rid of old things. I threw away an electric guitar that my dad had given me for my 16th birthday. I didn't think about it much until a few months ago, when I got an email from a guitar expert named Keith. He said he had found my old guitar and wanted to sell it back to me. I was surprised and happy to get it back. 
When I was a teenager, my parents wanted me to learn classical guitar, but I didn't like it. I switched to electric guitar and played simple songs. I didn't practice much, so I didn't get better. 
I took my guitar out of the box and remembered the day my parents gave it to me for my birthday. It felt smooth and heavy, and my fingers knew where to go. I started playing again, and it felt like I never stopped. The electric guitar is not meant to be played alone, so I might start a band with my son, who is learning to play the saxophone. Or maybe other people who have had a similar experience like mine can join us. We could call ourselves "The Regainers"!

There has been a lot of talk about sleep lately. When I wrote a book about people who can't sleep, I felt like I was warning people about the dangers of not sleeping enough. Sleep is very important for our minds, bodies, and moods. People who have trouble sleeping know how important it is.
Recently, people have been talking about sleep a lot. But what about dreams? We're losing our dreams because we wake up too early and cut off the last hour or two of sleep. Our most vivid and memorable dreams happen when we're in a special stage of sleep called REM. When we don't get enough REM sleep, our brains make up for it the next night.
Some scientists think dreams are important. They used to think that dreams helped us understand our minds, but now they think they might be more important for our physical health. A scientist from Harvard University says that there is not much agreement among dream researchers about what dreams are for.
A study found that people who are creative, like actors and writers, have better memories of their dreams. This makes sense because creative people need to think in new and interesting ways. But everyone needs to think creatively, not just artists. We need to be able to think creatively to solve problems and make good decisions.
Dreams can help us come up with new ideas and find new connections between things. Even if we can't remember our dreams, they can still help us think more clearly. I know that when I wake up from a good dream, I can write more easily and quickly. I'm not sure how it works, but it does.
We all need to be able to think creatively and solve problems. That's why we need to dream.

Twenty years ago, Susie Ray left London to live in a small town by the sea in southwest England. Her studio has a beautiful view of the sea. You'll notice empty frames on the walls, but there are also happy photos of her two daughters. Susie is a famous artist who copies famous paintings. She can make them look just like the originals. People think her copies are the real thing.
Susie has been doing this for 30 years. She has copied many famous paintings, including ones by Renoir, Monet, and Van Gogh. Her copies are so good that art experts think they are the originals. Susie's clients are galleries and collectors. Some collectors buy her copies because they love art, but others do it to show off.
Some famous people even buy her copies and pretend they are the originals. Susie doesn't mind. She just wants to make sure her copies are perfect. She believes that if she doesn't do it well, she would be cheating the original artist.
Susie didn't always copy paintings. After she finished art school, she worked as an illustrator for a botanical garden. She had to be very accurate and make sure everything was correct. This helped her become a good copyist. She also learned to draw and paint well.
Now, Susie specializes in copying French impressionist paintings. She loves the work of Manet, Cezanne, and Degas. She thinks people assume that modern art is easy to copy, but it's not. The impressionists were very good at what they did, and it's hard to copy them well.
You might wonder why Susie doesn't create her own art. She says she's a perfectionist and likes to focus on copying famous paintings. She has tried to create her own art, but it wasn't as good as her copies. Maybe it's because she's used to making perfect copies, and it's hard to be creative after a lifetime of doing something so well.

Ellen MacArthur loved the sea and racing on it. She was obsessed with being the fastest person on the water from a young age. She had a special connection with the boats that took her on long trips around the world. When she was on land, she felt like everyone was asking too many questions about her racing, and she just wanted to get back out on the water to test herself against nature.
After she finished the Vendée Globe race, a solo trip around the world, she took me on a tour of her boat, Kingfisher. She showed me how she planned everything carefully, even the smallest things like kitchen paper and food. She was very proud of her boat and how she took care of it because it was her home and her life depended on it.
Ellen sees the world like a boat - a small, beautiful thing that needs to be taken care of. She had an important moment when she visited a desolate island in the south Atlantic and saw abandoned whaling stations. It made her realize how we take things and then move on, without thinking about the consequences.
Ellen thinks we need to take action now to save the planet. She says we can't keep using up all the non-renewable resources we have. At first, she thought people should use less, but then she realized there's another way - we can reuse things. She's been visiting factories, mines, and power stations, talking to governments and businesses about this.
Ellen is not an expert, but she's like a sponge, soaking up information. She started a charity, the Ellen MacArthur Foundation, to help young people think about and design a sustainable future. She misses the adventure of being at sea, but she thinks this new message is even more important.

Jordan Romero is a 13-year-old boy who wants to climb Mount Everest, the highest mountain in the world. If he succeeds, he will be the youngest person to do so. Jordan's parents, Paul and Karen, are supporting him. They are a team, and their goal is not just to climb Everest but also to climb the highest mountains on each continent. Jordan has already climbed five of these mountains and might finish them all before he is 16.
Some experienced climbers think it's not a good idea for a 13-year-old to climb Everest. They say that a young climber might not be emotionally strong enough for the challenge. Jordan's parents have heard these concerns before, but they are confident that their experience as climbers will help them make the right decisions. They also think that Jordan is becoming stronger and more responsible every day.
Jordan's motivation for climbing Everest is to inspire other young people to get outside and be active. He wants to show them that it's possible to achieve big things if you work hard. Jordan's parents are not trying to make him famous; they just want to support him in his goals.
Jordan has to balance his love of adventure with the pressure to make his climb famous. He needs to blog, take photos, and give interviews to get people's attention. But his parents will stop the project if Jordan loses interest or decides he wants to do something else, like play basketball.

Do you know who Brahms was? Most people don't. I'm studying music, but my friends and I don't know much about classical music. In fact, many people don't own classical music recordings. Only 3% of concert tickets sold last year were for classical music events. The average classical recording sells only 300 copies. This is a big problem for people who love classical music.
Why don't people like classical music? One reason is that it's not easy to listen to. Classical music has many changes in mood and pace, which can be confusing for some people. We like fast-paced music and fast-paced activities. Classical music requires attention and concentration, which can be difficult for some people.
Pop music is simpler and easier to listen to. It's also about everyday life, which is more relatable to teenagers. Classical music is often about complex stories and doesn't have lyrics. The way we listen to music has also changed. In the past, families would play music together at home, and it was valued. Nowadays, we can find any music online, but classical music is not often part of our daily lives.
Some people think that classical music is more popular among older people, but I don't know why. I play classical music in an orchestra, but I don't love it. I enjoy many types of music. Some teenagers do like classical music, but they are a minority. They like it when they perform, but not as a hobby.

Bonnie Wyndham got out of her mother's car and looked at Almonside School. She was a little upset because she didn't want to be there. Her mother was getting out of the car too, but Bonnie didn't care if she heard her. Bonnie's mother knew how she felt.
Mrs. Wyndham looked around and saw that the school was a bit strange, with buildings hidden among the trees on a hill. She saw signs that said 'Science block', 'gymnasium', and 'riding centre'. Bonnie saw the 'riding centre' sign and got interested. Her mother said, 'Let's go this way.'
Bonnie followed her mother to the headmaster's office. Her mother talked to the headmaster while Bonnie waited outside. Bonnie didn't like waiting, so she decided to go to the riding centre. She saw a nice old building where the horses were kept and a big indoor riding area. There were no people around, but Bonnie liked the horses. She treated them with respect.
Bonnie looked at each horse and liked them all. But then she saw a special horse, a brown one with a little white. She liked him a lot. She said, 'I think we've met before, in my dreams. We were winning a big competition together.' The horse's name was Maverick. Bonnie couldn't resist the urge to ride him. She found a saddle and bridle and put them on Maverick. When she rode him outside, she felt like a queen. She laughed and said, 'You're the best horse I've ever ridden, Maverick. I think we could be great friends.' She rode him around the paddock and felt happy and free.

I've met Cody Simpson before and I'm impressed by his calm confidence. He's a 15-year-old Australian who has already released many successful songs. So, how did a laid-back surfer guy end up performing in front of thousands of fans? Cody started playing the guitar when he was six and writing songs when he was seven. But he was also a good swimmer and loved surfing. At 13, he was in high school and posting videos online. These videos became very popular, and record labels started contacting him. Cody had to make a difficult choice: continue swimming in Australia or move to the US to pursue his music career. He decided to take the risk and move to the US with his family. It was hard for him, especially at such a young age, to choose his career. He had to tell his swimming coach and friends that he was leaving. Cody is a modest person and thinks it's important to stay humble in the music industry. He packed his bags and moved to the US, giving up one dream to pursue another. Although his family is not in the spotlight, they are always there for him. Cody knows that having a close circle of friends and family is important to stay grounded. Sometimes he worries about the impact his decision has on his younger brother and sister, but his family reassures him that they are there to support him. To be successful, you need to be brave and take risks. Cody's success happened quickly and unexpectedly, and now he's performing in front of thousands of fans in countries he never thought he'd visit. But he knows it won't last forever.

I got out of bed, opened the curtain, and looked out the window. The river was frozen, but there was a small crack in the ice. I could see the wall of sandbags along the riverbank, which was there to protect the town from flooding. I had helped build those sandbags with the rest of the town's adults last week. My back still hurt from lifting them.
As I got dressed, I saw a boy on the other side of the river. He was trying to balance on a piece of ice near the factory's warm water outlet. I put on my kayaking suit and grabbed my life jacket. I checked my pocket for a special chain that my famous grandfather gave me. It's a reminder of his adventures in South America. I also have his old diary, which I keep under my pillow and read before bed.
I went to the kitchen to grab a banana and say good morning to my mom. She smiled and reminded me to be careful on the river. I headed downstairs and almost bumped into my grandfather in the hallway. He was grumpy and asked me where I was going. I told him I was going kayaking. He shouted at me to be more careful and asked what the point of training was, since I didn't win the competition. I took a deep breath and ignored him.
My mom came out of the kitchen and smiled sympathetically. She told me not to mind my grandfather's mood. I smiled back and said I would try to go easy on him. My grandfather used to be my hero, but he's been acting strange lately. I still want to be devoted to him, even though he's not always nice to me.
I finished my banana and went outside to the boathouse.

Mum grabbed Jess's arm. "Come with me," she said. Jess followed her to the study. There was a painting on the table. It was one of Grandpa's, but it was different from anything he had done before. "Do you know anything about this?" Mum asked. Jess shook her head. "I've never seen it before. I didn't know he was working on anything." Jess looked at the painting. There was a river in the picture, but it wasn't a real river. It was a fantasy river. The painting was strange and beautiful in a weird way. The riverbank was very small and green, but it was hard to notice because the eye was drawn to the water. There were no animals, birds, or people in the picture. It felt right that way. Jess was fascinated by the painting, thinking about autumn coming after a long, warm summer. Mum said, "It has a name." There was something in her voice that made Jess feel something was wrong. Grandpa never gave his paintings names. He just painted them and left others to figure out what they meant. Mum turned the painting over and showed Jess the words Grandpa had written. Jess read them out loud: "River Boy." The words seemed important, but Jess didn't know why. And there was a mystery. "There is no boy," Jess said. "Exactly," Mum said. "It's strange that Grandpa would be so specific. Maybe he'll add the boy later. I made the mistake of asking him about it." "Mum, you should have known better," Jess said. "I know, but I couldn't help it. The painting is unusual, especially with a name. I thought maybe you could tell me something about it, since you seem to inspire him." "Inspire him?" "Someone who helps an artist create," Mum explained. Jess knew what the word meant. Grandpa often used it when she watched him paint, but he never meant she was his muse. "He doesn't need me to inspire him," Jess said. "He's been painting all his life."

When I woke up this morning, I didn't mean to cut a hole in my bedroom carpet. I didn't plan to do it on purpose, but it might have been an accident. For example, I could have tripped over the bed with my dad's knife in my hand and accidentally cut the carpet. I'm not saying it happened, but it could have. I just didn't mean to damage the carpet. I wasn't thinking about cutting a hole when I woke up. I was trying to find a way to fit my small cabinet into a corner. My grandmother gave me the cabinet when she moved into a flat. It's a cute, small cabinet with pink and blue flowers and tiny glass doors. I keep my collection of shells and stones in it. My grandmother knew I loved the cabinet, and I was very happy when she gave it to me. The problem is that the cabinet is shaped like a triangle and needs to stand in a corner. I only have two corners in my bedroom, so I had to think of a solution. I tried to fit the cabinet into the angle between the roof and the floor, but it was too tall. I thought about cutting a small piece off the bottom of the cabinet, but then I had another idea. I could cut a hole in the carpet to make room for the cabinet. It seemed like a good idea at the time, but now I'm not so sure. Sometimes I do things without thinking, and then I regret it. My dad would probably be proud of me for thinking outside the box, but I'm not sure if he would be happy about the hole in the carpet.

"The book 'The Borrowers' is about a family of tiny people who live in the walls and floors of a house. They take things from the normal-sized people who live there. When I was asked to make a TV version of the book, I knew it would be hard to please everyone. People who love the book have strong ideas about how it should be made. I used the original drawings from the book to make sure I got it right. The author wanted the series to be from the Borrowers' point of view, not from a human's. This made filming more complicated. The main problem was getting the size right. The Borrowers are ten times smaller than humans, so we had to film them from far away. When filming the human surroundings, we had to get down low to the ground. We developed a special technique to make the shadows look right. After the series was finished, a famous director, George Lucas, asked me how I did it. We built a special set for the Borrowers' home under the floorboards. The actors had to carry big objects, like giant scissors, and it was funny. We had to stop filming sometimes because the crew was laughing too much. In one scene, the Borrowers get swept down a drain. The actors said it was scary and they didn't have to act much. I wanted the costumes to be right, so I made them heavy and stiff, like doll clothes. This made it hard for the actors to move. They couldn't sit down or take off their clothes. The weather was hot during filming, and the actors didn't thank me for the costumes! We had to film most of the scenes with the actors separated from their surroundings. We used a blue screen and drew pictures of each scene to show the actors what to do. It was a lot of work, but it was worth it in the end. I think the series was successful in capturing the magic of the books."

Mom stops the car in front of my new school, Palm Grove High School. She looks around nervously, making sure there are no journalists. She's worried about what will happen. It always happens like this. People will try to be friends with me because my dad is a famous musician. They'll ask me for favors or want to get close to my dad.
I tell Mom everything will be okay. She gives me a kiss and leaves me to start my new school. This is what I wanted - a chance to leave my old life and tour tutors behind. My band is recording an album nearby, but we're staying in this town for good. I want to meet normal kids, not just people who know my dad.
I go to the school office and ask for my schedule. The secretary is not very friendly. She looks confused when I tell her my name is Desert McGraw. She types my name into the computer and gives me my schedule. I see that I have English Literature first period. I like English, so that's good.
I look at the map I studied last night to find my classroom. When I get there, the teacher is taking roll. I slip in quietly and sit down. The girl next to me smiles and likes my shoes. I didn't mean to wear such fancy shoes, but they're my favorite.
The teacher introduces herself and gives us our course outlines. We have to read some books, and she lets us talk for a bit. My new friend asks me why I moved here. I could tell her the truth, but I don't want to. So I say my dad had to move for work. My friend is nice and asks me more questions. I'm glad I can talk to her and feel like a normal person for a change.

Being a teenager in the US is not easy. They are expected to do many things well. They must be good at school, have a part-time job, volunteer, and have a social life. Teenagers can't just blend in and be average. They must be good at everything.
Many people think that teenagers are lazy and don't care about their work. But this is not true. Teenagers have a lot of responsibilities. They have homework, tests, and extra activities, and they also have to help at home and have a social life. 
Some people think that teenagers spend all their time watching TV and playing with their phones. But this is not true. Teenagers use their phones to help them with their work and to stay in touch with their friends and family.
Teenagers have a lot of work to do. They often start their day early and finish late at night. They may not get enough sleep and may even fall asleep in school. 
Despite all their responsibilities, many teenagers are kind and want to help others. They volunteer and do other things to make a positive impact in their community.
In the future, people will probably still have wrong ideas about teenagers. But teenagers will continue to prove them wrong and make a difference in the world.

The Earth to Sky Calculus Club is a group of teenagers from Bishop, a town surrounded by wilderness in the US. They have launched over 50 balloons to space, 35 km above the Earth's surface. The project is a combination of science and adventure. I joined them for a weekend in the spring to help them launch a high-altitude balloon to record shooting stars.
Shooting stars happen when a rock or piece of metal enters the Earth's atmosphere and produces a trail of light. The balloon has a special box attached to it with a camera, a device to measure altitude, and a thermometer to measure temperature changes. Two GPS trackers help them find the balloon later. The balloon is inflated with a special gas tank, which is donated by someone in a neighboring state.
When it's time to launch, the group counts down and the balloon starts to rise. They track its path with flashlights until it disappears into the night. After the launch, most students go home, but a few stay to watch the shooting stars. They lie on blankets and look at the incredibly clear sky, which is hard to believe is just four hours from a big city like Los Angeles.
The balloon rises higher and higher until it pops in a big explosion. A parachute helps the equipment inside the box land safely back on Earth. The students will find it the next day using the GPS trackers. It's not always easy to get the box back, but that's part of the fun. The group has only lost two boxes in 53 launches.
The group's leader says that the journey is part of the adventure, and they've become more familiar with the landscape. On this occasion, the box landed 84 km west of Bishop, and it took them 11 hours to find it. It was in a canyon, high on a flat rock, near a waterfall. Unfortunately, the camera didn't record any shooting stars, but it was a great opportunity to talk about the effects of atmospheric waves. It's also a great story to tell.

Chloe Morgan didn't like science or palaeontology when she was younger. She only started to get interested in it when she was 15 years old. She was helping her younger brother with a school project and read an article about recent discoveries in the field. This really fascinated her and she decided to learn more.
Chloe remembers meeting a professional palaeontologist named Matt Cornelius when she was still young. She was nervous, but he was kind and patient with her questions. This made her feel more at ease.
I asked Chloe about how palaeontologists are often portrayed in movies and TV shows. She said that some films, like Jurassic Park, have made people more interested in dinosaurs, but they often show palaeontologists as weird or unlikable. She thinks this is not accurate and that real palaeontologists are normal people who do many different tasks, like digging up fossils and writing reports.
Chloe explained that her job is varied and includes both fieldwork and laboratory work. She also spends time explaining science to the public, which she enjoys. She thinks it's important to help people understand science and to show them how it can be interesting and fun.
Chloe was involved in a recent TV documentary about dinosaurs called Walking with Dinosaurs. She was happy to help the producers make sure that the dinosaurs were accurate and that the show was educational.
Chloe thinks that dinosaurs are still fascinating because they remind us of the unknown and the excitement of discovery. She believes that palaeontology is a way to travel back in time and learn about the past.

When you go on a car trip with your family, you know you're not there yet, even if you ask 'Are we there yet?' many times. And when you finally arrive, it's not 'there' anymore, it's 'here'. So, you should ask 'Are we here yet?' instead. Parents get tired of answering this question over and over during long car trips. They wish they could relax and enjoy the journey. 
Imagine being in the back seat, watching movies, listening to music, or doing puzzles while looking at the beautiful views outside. The parents will take care of everything, like giving you snacks and drinks. But sometimes, something unexpected happens, like my brother putting his foot on my side of the seat. This can start a fight, and the parents have to intervene. 
After a while, everything calms down again, and we continue the journey. Sometimes, I try to read a book, but then I feel a cold breeze on my arm. I look around, and my brother is blowing on me on purpose! He's not touching me, but it's still annoying. This makes me angry, and we have another argument. 
Our dad has learned some tricks to keep us quiet during the trip. For example, he says, 'We're there!' even when we're still on the highway. This works for a while, but you know you're really 'there' when the grown-ups get out of the car and go away from us kids. So, remember: if your parents are still near, the answer is no, you're not there yet.

John and Zuzi Morgan have opened a café in Oxford where people can play board games and have a cup of coffee. They want people to enjoy the experience so much that they will come back again. Zuzi explains why they started this business: 'We wanted to bring people together again. Everyone is busy with their phones and gadgets. We wanted to make it a place where people can talk to each other face-to-face.' The games they play are called 'Eurogames'. They are games that are easy to understand and have fun themes like building farms or landscapes. The first game of this type was 'The Settlers of Catan', where players build settlements and trade with each other. This game was created by a German designer named Klaus Teuber.
Later, 'co-operative' games were invented, where players work together as a team. This type of game encourages people to talk to each other and work together. One popular co-operative game is 'Pandemic', where players work together to solve global problems. The game was created by Matt Leacock, an American game designer. He was inspired by another game called 'Lord of the Rings', which is based on a book.
Matt Leacock has been playing board games since he was a child. He used to get frustrated with games because they were too complicated or boring. So, he started designing his own games with the help of his uncle. His game 'Pandemic' was very successful and has been followed by other games.
The growth of video games has actually helped the popularity of board games. Many people who play video games also enjoy playing board games with their friends and family. The rise of mobile gaming has made it easy for people to play games anywhere, anytime. John and Zuzi's café is a place where people can come together and play games in person. This trend is likely to continue, as people are looking for ways to connect with others in the real world.

Jamie Scott is a successful songwriter and producer in the music industry. He believes that perseverance and hard work are essential for success, even if it takes time to achieve your goals. Jamie's mother was a good singer and taught him how to play the guitar. He grew up listening to music from a local radio station that played songs for older people, which influenced his taste in music.
When Jamie was 12, he had to choose between playing tennis at a high level and pursuing music. He decided to focus on music and spent his lunch breaks at school practicing on the piano. At 17, he left school to try to become a performer. He was part of a duo with a friend, but they didn't share the same passion for music. Jamie's parents gave him a deadline to make it as a musician, and if he didn't succeed, he would have to get a job.
After a few close calls with record labels, Jamie was signed to a music publisher at 19. However, the record labels only wanted him as a solo artist, so he had to split with his friend. Jamie eventually found success behind the scenes, writing songs for other artists. He believes that writing songs that people love is important and that he has a natural ability to do it.
In an age where people often pretend to be modest, Jamie is honest about his goal: to write huge songs that go to number one. He doesn't feel guilty about it and is willing to work hard to achieve it. His goal is to write music that is both good and popular.

Tony Connor is a famous person on the internet, but not many people know who he is. He's a street trials cyclist, which means he rides a bike and does tricks and stunts. He films himself doing these stunts and puts them on the internet. I met him at a BMX park on a Saturday morning. Many people knew who he was and came to say hello. When I saw him do some of his tricks, I was very impressed. He's very brave and creative.
Tony doesn't like being famous. He prefers to focus on his bike riding rather than talking to people. He says that social media has changed the way people interact with each other, and he's not sure he likes it. However, he's grateful for the opportunity to make a living doing what he loves.
I've learned that there are two important things that help someone become a great athlete: energy and the ability to overcome disappointment. These qualities are more important than natural talent. Tony has these qualities, which is why he's so good at what he does. He's not always perfect and sometimes falls off his bike. But he gets back up and keeps trying until he gets it right.
Some people think Tony is reckless and takes too many risks. But he says they don't understand the sport and the precautions he takes to stay safe. He's not addicted to risk and spends a lot of time planning and preparing for each stunt. He knows that fear is normal, but he finds ways to overcome it.

In the UK and other countries, there has been a big change in higher education. Now, students are encouraged to start doing research early in their studies. This is because research is not just for famous professors or scientists who are making new discoveries. Research is a way for anyone to learn and grow. It's a way to think critically and solve problems.
As a student, you are already doing research every day. You ask questions, find answers, and make connections between what you learn. You might research what to wear, how to cook, or how to fix something. In college, you'll learn to ask even more questions and think critically about what you read and hear.
Some people might think it's not okay to question what they're told, especially if it's from a teacher or an expert. But in higher education, it's encouraged to question and think for yourself. You need to be able to think critically and not just accept what you're told.
Research is important because it helps us build new knowledge and skills. It's not just about repeating what others have said, but about making new discoveries and finding new answers. So, as a student, you'll learn to ask questions, find answers, and think critically. This will help you not only in your studies but also in your future career.

Cities have always been important for intellectual life. People have always gathered in cities to discuss ideas and share knowledge. For example, in 18th-century London, people met in coffee shops to talk about science and politics. In modern Paris, the famous artist Pablo Picasso would talk about modern art in cafes.
However, city life is not easy. Cities can be overwhelming and stressful. In fact, scientists have discovered that cities can even affect our brains and make us less clever. One reason for this is that cities are often far from nature. Studies have shown that people who can see trees from their hospital windows recover faster. Even just looking at nature can improve our thinking.
This is important because most people now live in cities. Instead of living in the countryside, we are surrounded by concrete and many people. This can affect our mental and physical health. Our brains have to work hard to deal with all the things we see and hear in a city. This can be tiring and make us feel exhausted.
Scientists have discovered that cities can be too full of stimuli, which means our brains have to work hard to focus. This is known as attention restoration theory. In natural settings, our brains don't have to work as hard, so we can relax and feel more focused.
For a long time, people have known that attention is a limited resource. If we focus in the morning, it's harder to focus in the afternoon. Scientists have also found that being in nature can help our brains recover.
Philosophers and landscape architects have been warning about the effects of city life and trying to find ways to bring nature into cities. Parks and green spaces can be very helpful. Even a short walk in a natural place can improve our brain function.
Despite the problems that cities can cause, they are still important for intellectual life. In fact, cities are often where new ideas and innovations come from. This is because cities bring people together and create opportunities for social interaction.
The key is to find a balance between the benefits of city life and the need for nature and relaxation.

Where is the mind? This might seem like a strange question. We think we know the answer: our minds are inside our heads. But I think we should look beyond our skin and skull. There is a lot of evidence that shows how things, not just our brains, help us think and learn.
In archaeology, we can see how old objects, like stones and tools, played a big role in human evolution and how we developed our minds. So, what's outside our heads might not be outside our minds.
It's easy to understand why people think the mind and brain are the same thing. Scientists study people's brains using special machines, but this can make us forget that we think with things around us too. I'm not saying that our brains don't matter, but I think we should look at how our minds work with the world around us.
I have a new idea called Material Engagement Theory (MET). It's about how things become a part of us and how we use them to think. For example, when we use a stick, it becomes a part of our body. This helps us understand what our minds are made of and how they change.
A blind person using a stick is a good example. Where does their self begin? The stick is a part of them, and it helps them feel the world. This shows us that our minds are always changing and adapting to new things.
I think our minds are like a project that is always being updated. We use things to learn and discover the world. That's why humans make things, and those things help shape our minds. I call this "metaplasticity" - our minds are plastic and change as we use the world around us.
I want to show that things are important for our thinking. MET helps us understand how different objects, from old stones to new smartphones, have helped us think and change who we are.

Photography has changed the way we see the world and our understanding of it. In the United States, photography became an important part of the country's culture, not just for scientists and artists, but for everyone. Historians say that photography is one of the most significant contributions the US has made to the visual arts.
So, why was photography so popular? One reason was that it was a new technology that matched the growing interest in innovation and progress in the US. It also made it possible to share images of faraway places and events with others, which was exciting and groundbreaking. Another reason was that photography allowed people to take pictures of themselves and their families, which was a way to show off their identity and share their experiences with others.
Photography also became a way for artists to express themselves and tell stories. Photographs can be seen as a way to point out something important, to say "look at this!" And because photographs are made by machines, they can be seen as objective records of what was in front of the camera. But at the same time, the person taking the picture can also bring their own perspective to the image.
Photographs can have different meanings depending on the context in which they are seen. For example, a picture of a person might mean something different if it is seen in a newspaper, a magazine, or a gallery. To understand a photograph, we need to consider its purpose and the cultural context in which it was created.
In recent decades, artists have used photography in their work, incorporating it into paintings, sculptures, and other forms of art. Photography has become an essential part of the way we represent the world and ourselves.

William James, an American philosopher and doctor, defined psychology as the study of mental life. This definition is still relevant today. We all have a mental life, and we can understand it by studying our own thoughts, feelings, and experiences. However, it's not easy to understand because it's personal and private. We can make judgments about psychology based on our own experiences, but this can be limited.
Psychologists try to find the truth by studying human behavior and using scientific methods. They want to understand why people think, feel, and behave in certain ways. They also want to know how to help people overcome problems and improve their lives.
It's difficult to study the mind directly, so psychologists study behavior instead. They observe people's actions and try to understand what's going on inside their minds. This is like solving a puzzle, where they use clues to figure out the answer.
Psychology is a science that aims to describe, understand, predict, and change the things it studies. It has many practical applications, such as helping children learn to read, designing safer machines, and treating people with emotional problems.
In the past, psychologists used to rely on their own thoughts and feelings to understand the mind. However, this method has limitations. Today, psychologists prefer to base their theories on observations of other people's behavior rather than their own experiences.

Here is the simplified text, written for a B1 level learner:
In a warehouse in Michigan, USA, there is a special collection of products that didn't sell well. It's called the Museum of Failed Products. The owner, Carol Sherry, thinks each product has a sad story behind it. The most surprising thing is that this museum exists and makes a profit. Many companies don't keep failed products as a reminder of what didn't work.
The museum's owner, Robert McMath, started collecting products in the 1960s. He wanted to have a library of all new products, not just failed ones. But, surprisingly, most of the products he collected were unsuccessful. This is because most products don't sell well.
You might think that companies would keep failed products to learn from their mistakes. But many companies prefer to forget about their failures and focus on their successes. This is because they don't want to admit that they made a mistake. It's like the saying "most products fail".
The culture of optimism can also contribute to the existence of the museum. Many people believe that if they think positively, good things will happen. But research shows that this isn't always true. In fact, thinking too much about how well things will go can actually make people less motivated to achieve their goals.
Psychologist Carol Dweck says that our experiences of failure are influenced by our beliefs about ability. Some people think that ability is fixed, while others believe it can be developed through hard work and challenge. People who believe in a fixed ability are more likely to be afraid of failure, while those who believe in incremental ability see failure as an opportunity to learn and grow.
Overall, the Museum of Failed Products is a reminder that even with hard work and determination, not everything will be successful. It's okay to make mistakes and learn from them, and it's important to have a positive attitude, but not to the point of being unrealistic.

Many people think that sports teams do better when they play at home. But is this really true? Some experts have been studying this and they have found some interesting things. They want to know what makes players perform well and how to explain why teams do better at home.
Some people think that playing at home gives teams an advantage because of the fans. The fans cheer and make noise, which can help the team win. But, what if the team plays some of their home games in a different country? Would it still matter to the fans? Some fans might think that their team needs their support to win.
Scientists have been studying this and they have found some surprising things. They found that referees are more likely to make decisions in favor of the home team if they can hear the crowd noise. This is because the referees don't want to make the crowd angry.
Other experts have looked at how teams have done over time. They found that teams used to do much better at home than they do now. This might be because travel is easier now and teams are treated better on the road.
But, despite all these changes, teams still do better at home in some sports. For example, basketball and football teams do well at home, but baseball teams don't. This might be because basketball and football are team sports, where players need to work together. Baseball is a more individual sport, where players play one-on-one.
Some scientists have also looked at the players' hormones. They found that players have higher levels of a hormone called testosterone when they play at home. This might be because players feel more confident and motivated when they play at home.
Overall, there are many reasons why teams do better at home. It's not just because of the fans, but also because of the players and the way they feel when they play at home.

Gary Player, a famous golfer, once said, 'The more I practise, the luckier I get.' But what did he really mean? He was being ironic and meant that the more he practises, the better he gets. This idea is important in sports and has been discussed by many experts. Some people believe that talent is born, while others think it's acquired through practice. 
A psychologist named Anders Ericsson said that with 10,000 hours of practice, anyone can become an expert in any field. Many books have been written about this idea, saying that practice is more important than talent. However, some experts disagree. They think that it's not just about practice, but also about a person's natural ability.
The author of this book, Epstein, wants to find out what makes some people excel. He thinks that many studies only look at successful people and try to figure out why they're successful. He wants to know if there are other factors that affect people's abilities.
Epstein travels around the world to find answers. He learns about sled dogs in Alaska and how their drive and desire to work can be inherited. This makes him think that maybe our drive and determination can also be influenced by our genes.
The author says that there are two important things: 'hardware' (our natural abilities) and'software' (what we learn and experience). Both are important, but in some cases, our natural abilities can be more important. He also talks about how men and women are separated in sports competitions, which raises questions about why this is the case.
The best questions are often the most obvious ones.

Many children in rich countries feel unhappy and lonely. Jay Griffiths, an author, thinks she knows why. She believes that children are spending too much time indoors, looking at screens, and not enough time playing outside in nature. She thinks this is the main problem. This idea is also supported by other experts who have talked to children about their unhappiness. The children didn't say they wanted more gadgets, but many said they would be happier if they could go outside more often.
Many adults remember their own childhoods fondly, saying they had more freedom to play outside and explore. However, they often forget that they are the ones who are now keeping their own children indoors, worrying about their safety. Griffiths argues that this fear of danger is linked to the toy and gadget industry, which wants to sell products to keep children entertained indoors.
Griffiths also criticizes some modern trends, such as giving children medication to calm them down or making them wear goggles to play. While these ideas might not be common, Griffiths is passionate about her arguments and has some good points. However, she sometimes goes too far and ignores opposing views. She even compares the way we treat children to a form of racism.
Griffiths believes that children should be allowed to be free and take risks. She thinks that they need to experience some danger to learn how to manage it. However, she doesn't explain how to achieve this. Additionally, not all children are adventurous and some might prefer to stay indoors. Maybe the biggest problem is forcing all children to fit into the same mold, whether it's keeping them indoors or pushing them to be adventurous.

I'm a psychologist who has studied a lot. I'm good at solving problems, but this has nothing to do with my education. Most problems in life can't be solved with formulas or memorized answers. They require common sense, wisdom, and creativity, which come from life experiences. For children, these experiences come from playing.
I'm studying how important play is for children's development. All mammals, including humans, play when they're young. Those that have the most to learn play the most. Children need to learn a lot, so they play a lot when they're allowed to. Play is the natural way for people and animals to learn.
The most important skills children need to learn to live happy and productive lives can't be taught in school. These skills are learned through play. They include being creative, getting along with others, and controlling their emotions. Creativity is important for success. We need people who can think creatively and solve new problems.
Albert Einstein, a famous scientist, said that his school experience almost stopped him from being interested in math and science, but he recovered his interest when he left school. He called his innovative work "combinatorial play". He developed his idea of relativity by imagining a scenario and thinking about the consequences.
We can't teach creativity, but we can stop it by making school too focused on what adults think is important, rather than what children are interested in. Even more important than creativity is being able to get along with others and care about them.
Children are born with a strong desire to play with others, and this is how they learn social skills and fairness and morality. Play is voluntary, which means players can always stop if they want to. This makes play the most democratic activity.
Unfortunately, school has become more stressful, with less time for breaks and more homework. Outside of school, adult-directed sports have replaced impromptu games, and adults often intervene instead of letting children solve their own problems. This has been happening gradually, but it's had a big impact.
We need to give children more freedom to play and explore, so they can grow into strong, capable adults.

Many young people in their twenties are using social media to find a job. They think it's a good way to get in touch with potential employers. But social media can also be a trap. A young jobseeker in the US sent a message to a senior marketing executive on LinkedIn. The executive was not happy with the message and sent a rude reply. This made many people realize that social media can be a dangerous tool for jobhunters who don't know how to use it.
For many young people, social media is a part of their daily life. They use it to talk to friends and family, share pictures and updates. But using social media for work is different. It's not just about sharing funny pictures or updates. It's about being professional and respectful.
Some young people are making mistakes on social media. They are sending messages that are too casual or arrogant. This can make it hard for them to get a job. Employers don't like it when young people are too familiar or seem to think they are entitled to a job.
So, how can young people use social media to find a job? First, they should explain who they are and what they can do for the person they are contacting. They should also be humble and polite. Sending a message that is too casual or arrogant can ruin their chances of getting a job.
Remember, social media can be a great tool for finding a job, but it needs to be used carefully. Young people need to be professional and respectful if they want to make a good impression.

Newspapers are in trouble. Many people think they will soon disappear. Since 2000, the number of people reading newspapers in the UK has gone down by a third to half. In the US, only 26% of people get their news from newspapers, compared to 45% in 2001. Some experts predict that the last newspaper will be gone in 15 years. However, old media have a way of surviving. For example, books, theatre, and cinema have all had to compete with new technologies, but they are still popular.
Newspapers were once new and exciting, but it took a long time for them to become the main way people got their news. This was because it was hard to produce and distribute newspapers quickly and cheaply. People used to think that the world was a stable and predictable place, and they didn't need to know what was happening all the time. But now, we expect things to change and we want to be up-to-date.
The way we get our news is changing. We can now choose what we want to read and when we want to read it. We can also correct mistakes and misunderstandings quickly. Newspapers used to have to fit a lot of information into a small amount of space, which made it hard to tell complex stories. Now, we can share more information and provide more context.
Some people think that newspapers are not doing a good job of explaining how the world works. Maybe they will disappear. Or maybe they will find a new way to help us understand the world and make sense of the chaos around us.

If we were meant to live in the moon's light, we would be happy in the dark. But we're not. Our eyes are adapted to living in the sun's light. This is something we're born with, even if we don't think about it much. We've found ways to make the night brighter by adding artificial light. This is like controlling a river. It has its benefits, but also some negative effects, called light pollution. This is when we shine light upwards into the sky, instead of keeping it on the ground where it's needed. This can affect many living things, including us. Some animals, like birds, migrate at night and can get confused by artificial light. This can even affect how we sleep and feel physically.
In the past, cities were much darker at night. Imagine walking through London at night in the 1800s. There were only a few lights, and you would have smelled the city more than seen it. We've made the night brighter as if it were an empty space, but it's not. Many animals are nocturnal, and light affects them. Some birds are attracted to artificial light and can get trapped. Even humans need darkness to be healthy. Denying ourselves darkness can cause problems. Our bodies need a regular rhythm of day and night to stay healthy.
In the end, we're trapped by light pollution, just like animals near a brightly lit highway. We've cut ourselves off from our natural heritage - the stars and the rhythms of day and night. Light pollution makes us forget our place in the universe and our connection to the natural world.

The boss of a big company recently announced that they will no longer track how many holidays their employees take. This idea came from another company that has already done the same thing. However, the two companies are very different. The smaller company has only 2,000 employees and does one thing, while the big company has 50,000 employees and does many different things.
The idea is that employees can take as much time off as they want, as long as they are sure it won't harm the company. But is this possible? It's hard to be 100% sure that your work is up to date and that your absence won't cause problems. Even if you do everything you can to prepare, there will always be a lot of work to come back to.
This policy might not be good for the company. Employees might not take holidays because they will feel guilty or worried about the work they will miss. They might also feel pressure from colleagues and gossip about who is taking time off. In the past, people have been used to having a certain amount of holiday time, and now they might feel like they have to take less. This could lead to stress and a decrease in productivity.
Modern technology makes it easy to work at any time and in any place, which can make it hard to separate work and leisure time. Some people might feel like they are always working, even when they are on holiday. Employment laws are in place to protect workers' health and well-being. Workers need rest and leisure time to stay healthy and happy. I'm not sure if this policy will really help employees take more holidays or if it will just cause problems.

Journal-based peer review is the process of checking a scientific research paper by experts in the same field. It is supposed to make sure that only good and accurate papers are published. However, some people think that this system has problems. Reviewing a paper can take a long time, and some scientists are not sure if it's worth the wait.
I think that journal-based peer review is important, but I also think that we need to change the way we do things. One way to do this is by using preprints. A preprint is a draft of a paper that is shared online before it is officially published. This allows other scientists to read and comment on the paper quickly, which can help to improve the research.
Some scientists are worried that using preprints could lead to bad science being published. However, this has not happened so far. In fact, preprints can help to make sure that research is shared quickly and widely, which is important for the scientific community.
One advantage of preprints is that they allow scientists to share their work quickly, even if it is not perfect. This can be helpful for sharing negative results, which are often not published in traditional journals. Preprints can also increase the number of times a paper is read and cited, which is important for scientists who want to share their work with others.
Overall, I think that preprints can be a useful way to improve the way we do science. They can help to make sure that research is shared quickly and widely, and they can help to focus attention on the work itself, rather than where it is published.

When I ask my students to define a poem, they usually say it's like a painting with words. But I don't find their answers satisfying. One day, I asked them to write a paragraph about an object, first as a scientist would, and then from the object's point of view. One student chose an oxygen mask and wrote: "I may look strange, but I help people breathe. I'm only used in emergencies and most people will never need me." This exercise helped my students understand how poetry is unique.
I used to think poetry was confusing and got in the way of understanding and feeling. But now I think poetry can be useful. When we read a poem, we might look for deep feelings, beautiful images, and clever ideas. But sometimes we can find these things in other forms of art, like films, novels, or music. Poetry is special because it can be ambiguous, like everyday life. We might not always understand a poem, but that's what makes it interesting.
Some people try to define poetry by comparing it to other things, like a machine or a wild animal. But these comparisons don't work. Instead, trying to define poetry can help us think about what we mean by machine or wild animal. Poetry can also be like a song, with words and music working together to create something powerful.
A poem can be surprising and special because it's not like other writing. It's not meant to be sold or used for a specific purpose. A poem is its own reason for being. Because of this, a poem can still surprise us, even if only for a moment.

I bought my first metal detector when I got married. It was a big expense, but my wife, Marion, was impressed when I found a gold ring worth £80 on my first try. Over the years, I've found many other interesting things, like old brooches and coins. These discoveries make me feel connected to the past. After finding the gold ring, it took 40 years for me to find something else that impressed Marion as much. On a rainy afternoon, I went to a spot I knew had old farming equipment. My detector beeped, and I dug up a piece of a metal wheel. Then, it beeped again. I couldn't ignore it, so I dug deeper. As I brushed away the dirt, I saw a golden ball. It looked like a loop with intricate patterns. I knew what it was - the Great Torc, a famous necklace from ancient Britain, over 2,000 years ago. I took it to the car and couldn't stop staring at it. When I got home, I showed it to Marion, and we both stared in amazement. We didn't try it on because we didn't want to damage it. We kept it in our wardrobe, but I was worried someone might steal it, so I hid it in my office. I had to report it to the authorities, and eventually, I sold it to the council. The money was split between me and the owner of the field. The £350,000 was a big surprise! Some people think I'll stop detecting now, but I love finding new things, just like a fisherman loves catching fish.

I love sleeping when I'm traveling. But I don't talk about it much because I feel a bit guilty. When my friends share their detailed travel plans, I smile and don't say much. They plan their days carefully, with lots of activities like visiting museums and going for hikes. But my travel plans are different. I like to leave some time for sleeping in the afternoon or taking a nap in the morning. It's one of the best things about traveling.
When I went to the Yucatán coast in Mexico, I was surprised to find that I slept a lot. I would sleep for more than 12 hours a day. It was strange, but I didn't mind. I was far from home and my own bed, and everything was new and different. I could sleep deeply and have nice dreams.
When we travel, we open ourselves up to new experiences and sights. We take in new cultures, music, and ways of living. And it's when we sleep that we process all of this new information. That's why sleep is so important when we're traveling.
Sleep is also different from place to place. In some places, people sleep at different times or in different ways. For example, on the island of Trinidad, people wake up early and sleep in the middle of the day. It took me a few days to get used to this new rhythm. When I finally adjusted, I felt like I had really arrived.
I remember a day in Santo Domingo when I had a big lunch with some new friends. We ate a lot and then everyone started to feel tired. We all lay down on the couches and hammocks. It was a nice feeling, and I realized that this was a common thing to do in this culture.
Travel sleep has another good thing: it's something I remember. When I'm in a new place, I sleep and my brain fills up with new sights, sounds, and smells. It's a special part of traveling. Maybe I should stop feeling embarrassed about sleeping a lot and just enjoy it.

Mia, a hat shop owner, was helping a customer choose a hat. The customer didn't like the first one Mia suggested, but Mia thought it would suit her. The customer wanted to stand out at her daughter's wedding, so she chose a small, red and black hat with a bow.
Mia thought about her own daughter, Jen, who was turning 30 today. Mia was looking forward to seeing her and her family, including her husband Jeff and their son Luke. Mia's husband, Jeff, was a straight-talker and didn't like fancy things. He would have told the customer the truth about the hat, even if it wasn't what she wanted to hear.
Mia had converted a barn on her property into a hat shop, which was a success. She sold hats and other accessories, and women came from all around to visit her. Mia's shop was in a small village, and she made sure her customers felt comfortable and relaxed while they shopped.

Lawrence Okoye has moved from London to Atlanta, USA. He's a talented athlete who has gone from throwing the discus to playing American football. It's a big change, but Lawrence is confident he can make it. He never played American football before, but he's been picked for a big team. He's still learning the rules and his new position.
Lawrence is 21 years old and was a good discus thrower. He was even ranked number four in the world. He came to Atlanta to train for the world championships, but then he decided to try out for the American football team. He had always thought about playing football, but it seemed crazy at first.
Lawrence didn't worry about being nervous at the tryouts, even though he had never played the game before. He just applied online and showed up. He did well in the tests and drills and was chosen for the team. He's not sure what his new position is yet, but he's excited to learn.
Some people think it's strange for someone who has never played football to join a big team. But Lawrence is focused on his goals. He knows he can always go back to throwing the discus if American football doesn't work out. He's just trying to achieve his dreams.

I had been flying for a long time and woke up to see that it was already daytime. I looked out the window and saw a vast, empty landscape. It was a beautiful sight, with mountains, streams, and forests stretching to the horizon. My neighbor, Sergei, woke up and smiled at me. He was a salesman from Moscow who was going to sell safety clothes to mining companies in a remote area. His English was not very good, but we managed to communicate using a dictionary. I told him I was going to Magadan, a city in eastern Siberia, with only a one-way ticket. I planned to ride my bicycle back to England. Sergei was surprised and said, 'But there is no road from Magadan. You can't ride a bicycle.' I told him I thought there was a road, even if not many people used it. 'Alone?' he asked. 'No, I'll be with a friend,' I replied. Sergei looked unconvinced, so I showed him my warm clothes and explained that I had bought them cheaply. I didn't mention that I was on a tight budget because my trip was self-funded. 
It all started in a lecture hall in Scotland. I was thinking about a dilemma and decided to write a note to my friend Al. I asked him if he wanted to cycle across the Karakorum Highway between Pakistan and China that summer. He agreed, and it was six years later that I was going to join him in Siberia. 
I was a geography teacher, and although I still struggled with my classes, I loved the job. It was challenging, never boring, and I had long holidays to go on adventures. I had gone on two adventures with Al since we started teaching. He had caught the adventure bug after our bike ride in Pakistan and decided to cycle around the world. This was his biggest challenge yet. He sometimes thought the ride would break him, but he was proving the skeptics wrong and feeling alive.

In the Red Bull Air Race, 12 pilots fly their planes through a course with tall pylons. They do sharp turns, barrel rolls, and loops at very high speeds. I got to try it out. Before the flight, I had to sign two forms. One said I was healthy, and the other said I would empty my pockets because small things can be dangerous in the air. I also learned to keep my eyes on the horizon and relax when we're upside down.
During the safety briefing, I was told not to touch anything. When we were ready to take off, my legs were shaking because I was worried. The pilot, Dario, and I were in a very fast plane, the Zivko Edge 540. We took off and did a sharp turn to the right. I felt the air go out of my lungs, and I looked up at the horizon. We did some more turns and dives, and I felt like I was going to be sick. We flew very low over the ground, and I was scared.
But then Dario let me fly the plane for a bit. It was very responsive, and I was shaking with excitement. After that, Dario did some more tricks, like a barrel roll and a loop. I was getting a bit scared, but I didn't want to say so. When we landed, Dario had some sandwiches, and I didn't eat for hours. That night, I kept dreaming about the flight and doing loops in my sleep.

Doug Allan is a wildlife cameraman who films animals in cold places. He loves his job and has been doing it for many years. He used to be a marine biologist and commercial diver. He learned about survival in cold places while diving.
Doug got his big break when a TV crew came to Antarctica to film a wildlife documentary. He took the crew to different places and realized that being a wildlife cameraman was the perfect job for him. He gets to travel, have adventures, and work underwater.
When Doug started, not many people had been to Antarctica. He was one of the first to film there. He says it's easier to film now because of the new technology. In the past, he had to remember what shots he needed to take and what he missed. Now, he can take many shots and review them immediately.
Doug is experienced in filming in cold conditions. He has spent a lot of time on sea ice and is comfortable in the cold. He says that filming wildlife is not always easy and can be full of surprises. Sometimes, he makes mistakes and has to deal with difficulties.
Doug recently filmed polar bears in the Arctic. It was a challenging assignment because it was very cold and snowy. He had to walk for hours each day and wait patiently for the bears to appear. Finally, he saw a mother bear and her cub. He was so excited to capture this moment on film.
Doug wants to make a new documentary about climate change in the Arctic. He wants to talk to the people who live there and show how climate change is affecting them. He thinks he could make an amazing documentary if he gets the chance.

Pen Hadow is an explorer who has done many amazing things. In 2004, he became the first person to walk to the North Pole alone and without help. He had to swim through very cold water, fight frostbite, and avoid polar bears. Eight months later, he walked to the South Pole too. Now, he's going back to the Arctic to do an even bigger expedition. This time, he'll be with two friends and they'll walk 1,000 kilometers to the North Pole to measure the thickness and density of the ice. Nobody has done this before, and the results will be very important for scientists.
Pen was trained for this kind of adventure from a young age. His father's old nanny, who used to work with a famous explorer, would send him outside in the cold and wind with hardly any clothes on to make him tough. Pen's love of adventure came from his father, and he grew up to be very strong and able to handle the cold. He's married to Mary, who loves the outdoors too, and they have two children. Mary says Pen is very brave and has a strong spirit.
Pen is a bit worried about being away from his family this time. He made a mistake last time and said something to his son that made him feel too responsible. This time, he wants to stay in touch as little as possible so he can focus on the expedition. He's very careful about his equipment and is making sure everything is perfect before he leaves. He'll be with two other experienced explorers and a team of six people who will bring them supplies.
Pen thinks this expedition is important because it will help scientists understand what's happening to the ice in the Arctic. He believes that explorers like him can make a difference and do something useful for the world.

I took a year off after being a professional athlete. I did some writing and TV work, and spoke to businesses and schools. But I missed the excitement of competing. To stay in shape, I started doing marathons and triathlons. Then, my friend Ben Fogle asked me to row across the Atlantic with him. I loved rowing and missed the feeling of being on the water. But I wasn't sure if I was ready to train every day. I talked to some rowing friends, but they weren't interested. I thought about the race and decided to join Ben. We had to pay a lot of money for the boat and equipment, £70,000! We needed to work hard to make it happen. As a retired athlete, I make money by speaking at business conferences. But I find it hard to talk about my past achievements without having a new goal. This race would give me a new goal and something to work towards. I learned a lot while preparing for the race. One of the biggest lessons was to appreciate the easy life of a full-time athlete. My training was tough, but it was set and I had help from doctors and dieticians. I was worried about people thinking I just wanted to be on TV, but I was surprised by how much Ben had to learn about rowing. He had done other tough challenges, but rowing was new to him. I could have been more patient, but I had to tell him the truth - he needed to improve a lot. I should have realized that when I agreed to race with him.
